text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments RONALDINHO has tipped Manchester City wonderkid Gabriel Jesus to overtake Lionel Messi as the world’s best player. 
The Brazilian has got off to a roaring start in the Premier League – booting top scorer Sergio Aguero out of the team. PA:Press Association Manchester City to give Gabriel Jesus another chance to prove his class against Bournemouth tonight after an impressive run of form 
And his fellow countryman believes Pep Guardiola has a special talent on his hands in the teen. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Ronaldinho, 36, said: “Manchester City have a very special player with Gabriel Jesus. 
“Maybe even, in the future, the best player in the world. Reuters 4 Ronaldinho established himself as world’s best with Ballon d’Or in 2005 
“At the moment it is Messi. I have always said I think one day it will be Neymar. 
“But at 19, in the future, it can be Gabriel. He has all the abilities to make that happen.” Related Stories Brazil-liant Gabriel Jesus has had no problems settling in at Manchester City... but gets a taste of home at team bonding trip to Brazilian restaurant 'Hello Mum, I love you' Man City star Gabriel Jesus reveals all about his Swansea goal phone celebration 'I CONVERTED JESUS' Fernandinho convinced Brazil pal Gabriel Jesus to choose City over Barca and Real Madrid 'I'm very surprised' Gabriel Jesus admits that even he is shocked by how well he has started at Manchester City KEEP THE FAITH Gabriel Jesus WON'T be able to keep up star performances, warns Manchester City team-mate Fernandinho Gift of the Gab Gabriel Jesus listens to local RADIO to pick up Manchester accent - but has so far only mastered 'mate' 
Jesus, 19, has taken no time at all to get used to his new surroundings after completing his move from Palmeiras, which was agreed last summer. 
And Ronaldinho – who won two Fifa World Player of the Year awards and a Ballon d’Or – was not surprised after watching him score five goals in six internationals. 
He added: “I don’t always agree that players should always be eased in — it depends on the type of player. 
“You look at Gabriel Jesus and he has no fear at all. He just wants to play and show what he can do. 
“He will put in big ­performances against Manchester United, Liverpool, Chelsea and all the other top teams in England. 
“I’m pleased he has been named in the Champions League squad and I think he should play, he is full of confidence. Ronaldo, Kaka, myself and, more recently, Neymar were playing at the highest level at a young age. Gabriel is in that ­category.” Getty Images Ronaldinho thinks both Neymar (left) and Jesuscan both be crowned the wordd’s best footballer one day Getty Images Fernandinho claims he persuaded Jesus to join Manchester City and has helped him settle along with Fernando Gabriel Jesus gets winner for Manchester City against Swansea 
Brazil internationals Fernandinho and Fernando helped Jesus settle at City, who needed the youngster to hit the ground running and kick-start their season. 
Guardiola said: “Fernandinho and Fernando did a really good job because they help him translate things and help him to be here. 
“It’s not easy for a young guy to come here and settle in a city during a season, but in the games you have seen what he has done. And not just with the ball, but without it and of course, it’s good news. 
“We’re happy with how he’s done so far.”
